buffalo3d.core

Class Scene

  • java.lang.Object
    • buffalo3d.core.Scene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDirtyParent, IObject3dContainer, IObject3dParent

    public class Scene
extends Object
implements IObject3dContainer, IDirtyParent
    The top of a object3d hierarchy, storing all the needed configurations of GL scene. For rendering objects, all top-level objects must be added into scene instance. It also provides several get/set method for GL effect setting.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets Scene to default settings. Removes and clears any attached Object3ds. Resets light list.

      • addChild

        public void addChild(Object3d $o)
        Adds object to scene's root object container. Objects must be added to root object container in order to be rendered Returns always true. Adds a child object. (Not recommend call it out of GL thread)
        Specified by:
        addChild in interface IObject3dContainer
        Parameters:
        $o - the child object to be added

      • addChildAt

        public void addChildAt(Object3d $o,
                       int $index)
        Adds object to specified position of scene's root object container. Objects must be added to root object container in order to be rendered Returns always true. Adds a child object with specified position. (Not recommend call it out of GL thread)
        Specified by:
        addChildAt in interface IObject3dContainer
        Parameters:
        $o - the child object to add
        $index - the position at which to add the child

      • removeChild

        public boolean removeChild(Object3d $o)
        Removes object from scene's root object container. Returns false if it's unsuccessful. Removes the specified child. (Not recommend call it out of GL thread)
        Specified by:
        removeChild in interface IObject3dContainer
        Parameters:
        $o - the child object to remove

      • removeChildAt

        public Object3d removeChildAt(int $index)
        Removes object from specified position of scene's root object container. Removes the child with specified position. (Not recommend call it out of GL thread)
        Specified by:
        removeChildAt in interface IObject3dContainer
        Parameters:
        $index - the child object to remove
        Returns:
        true if removing is successful.

      • removeAllChildren

        public void removeAllChildren()
        Removes all objects of scene's root object container. Call this method to remove all child object from the Container.
        Specified by:

      • getChildAt

        Parameters:

      • setMaterialDirty

        public void setMaterialDirty()

      • supportFullFeature

        public void supportFullFeature(boolean supportFullFeature)
        Determines if support full feature or common used feature. The function is available if developer use openglES2.0 and OpenGLV1Material material. If developer set ture, the OpenGLV1Material material support multi-texture, fog, teture mode, multi-lights .. If developer set false, the OpenGLV1Material material support single-texture, fog, multi-lights
        Parameters:
        supportFullFeature - true to support Full Feature.

      • supportFullFeature

        public boolean supportFullFeature()
        Indicates if support full feature.
        Returns:
        true if support Full Feature.

      • setMaterialType

        public boolean setMaterialType(int type)
        Determines which material will used for rendering object. In current stage, only support Simple and OpenglESV1 Material. Simple Material only support texture. OpenglESV1 Material support multi-texture, fog, teture mode, multi-lights.
        Parameters:
        type - SIMPLE_MATERIAL or OPENGLESV1_MATERIAL
        Returns:
        true if type is a available type.

      • getMaterialType

        public int getMaterialType()
        Indicates which material is used. In current stage, only support Simple and OpenglESV1 Material. Simple Material only support single-texture. OpenglESV1 Material support multi-texture, fog, teture mode, multi-lights.
        Returns:
        SIMPLE_MATERIAL or OPENGLESV1_MATERIAL

      • isInTouchMode

        public boolean isInTouchMode()
        Indicates whether we are in touch mode. Calling this method triggers an IPC call and should be avoided whenever possible.
        Returns:
        True, if the device is in touch mode, false otherwise.

      • checkForLeavingTouchModeAndConsume

        public boolean checkForLeavingTouchModeAndConsume(KeyEvent event)
        See if the key event means we should leave touch mode (and leave touch mode if so).
        Parameters:
        event - The key event.
        Returns:
        Whether this key event should be consumed (meaning the act of leaving touch mode alone is considered the event).

      • requestChildFocus

        public void requestChildFocus(Object3d child,
                              Object3d focused)
        Description copied from interface: IObject3dParent
        Called when a child of this parent wants focus
        Specified by:
        requestChildFocus in interface IObject3dParent
        Parameters:
        child - The child of this IObject3dParent that wants focus. This view will contain the focused view. It is not necessarily the view that actually has focus.
        focused - The view that is a descendant of child that actually has focus

      • clearChildFocus

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • focusSearch

        public Object3d focusSearch(Object3d obj,
                            int direction)
        Description copied from interface: IObject3dParent
        Find the nearest view in the specified direction that wants to take focus
        Specified by:
        focusSearch in interface IObject3dParent
        Parameters:
        obj - The view that currently has focus
        direction - One of FOCUS_UP, FOCUS_DOWN, FOCUS_LEFT, and FOCUS_RIGHT

      • focusableObjectAvailable

        public void focusableObjectAvailable(Object3d obj)
        Description copied from interface: IObject3dParent
        Tells the parent that a new focusable view has become available. This is to handle transitions from the case where there are no focusable views to the case where the first focusable view appears.
        Specified by:
        focusableObjectAvailable in interface IObject3dParent
        Parameters:
        obj - The view that has become newly focusable
